text: Jacopo Bedi, also known by Giacomo di Bedo di BenedettoArchivio storico per le Marche e per l'Umbria, Volume 3, page 34. (active 1432 – 1458) was an Italian painter of the Quattrocento. ==Biography== He was born in Gubbio, and active there, where he was felt to be a pupil of Ottaviano Nelli. There is one signed work by him, frescoes depicting the Life of St Sebastian for the Panfili Chapel in the cemetery of San Secondo in Gubbio from 1458.A New History of Painting in Italy, Volume 3, by Joseph Archer Crowe, Giovanni Battista Cavalcaselle, page 93.The Jews in Umbria: 1435-1484, page 842. ==References== Category:15th-century Italian painters Category:Quattrocento painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Umbrian painters Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Year of death unknown Category:People from Gubbio
